Unique identity of each site

seine sample replicate at each site visit (1 or 2)
distance along beach where replicate seine took place (meters)
time of sample replicate. Of format: hhmm
net size in meters (11 or 22)

categorical score for seine success. 1: seine deployed properly, no fouling, seine reached full depth throughout seine set; 2: diversity and abundance data suspect, length data usable, seine deployed improperly, seine partially fouled on debris, seine did not reach full depth for part of seine set; 3: all data suspect, very poor deployment, seine completely fouled, seine did not reach full depth
identification of fish species or group (code). See "fishcodes.csv" for identification codes
categorical lifestage of fish. 0: larvae, 1: juvenile, 2: adult, 3: mixed
count or estimate of fish (numerical)
number estimated from "abundance" (numerical)

name of person who checked data

Alphanumerical codes describing site-relative distance from shore and target depth of temperature, salinity and pH readings. A-D(distance from shore): A = depth of 0.5 meters, B = centre of seine, C = extent of seine, and D = 10 meters depth or 100m from shore (whichever is closer to shore), respectively. Numerical part indicates target depth of readings.
actual depth achieved (meters)
temperature (Celcius)
Salinity (parts per thousand)
pH

Unique identity of each site
year (20xx)
month (1-12)
distance from shore that the net reached for set 1. (meters)
width of seine net upon retrieval for set 1. (meters)
depth at the net extent for set 1. (meters)
distance from shore that the net reached for set 2. (meters)
width of seine net upon retrieval for set 2. (meters)
depth at the net extent for set 2. (meters)
notes on set dimensions
area of set 1. calculated as: A= (net_extent - 1/2(net_width))netwidth + 1/2(?1/2(net_width²)
volume of set 1. calculated as: V = area_set(depth_extent/2)
area of set 2. calculated as: A= (net_extent - 1/2(net_width))netwidth + 1/2(?1/2(net_width²)
volume of set 2. calculated as: V = area_set(depth_extent/2)

notes on bycatch data
unique identifier (code) used within bycatch data for each level of classification of bycatch
common name used for classification of bycatch
genus and species of bycatch. If species could not be ascertained, "spp" will follow the genus.
higher level classification of bycatch. Level of classification (Family, Order, etc.) is given followed by its designation. Higher level of classification is only given if genus was not ascertained.
unique identifier (code) used within abundance and length data for each level of classification of fishes
common name used for classification of fishes
genus and species of fishes. If species could not be ascertained, "spp" will follow the genus .
higher level classification of fishes. Level of classification (Family, Order, etc.) is given followed by its designation. Higher level of classification is only given if genus was not ascertained.
list of species in species complex. Format: "genus1_species1 genus2_species2 genus3_species3".
unique identifier (code) used within abundance and length data for each level of classification of fishes
genus and species or categorical classification of vegetation
